fandi, it takes roughly 45 secs on most desktops, maybe more on laptops, depending on how good they are.

you can check your activations with the Check_Activation_all.cmd I listed in the description.
You might need to right click it and run as administrator, I'm not certain. It wouldn't hurt.

I have done a lot of testing about the trigger stuff. and I must say that my trigger fix advice was sadly pre-mature.

Apparently the problem is that I was always running the "Run Trigger.cmd" as administrator.
You can simply ignore all of the advice in the special trigger fix thing for win8, and just run "Run Trigger.cmd" normally without right clicking and running as admin.

If you run normally it will install and overwrite any errors if necessary.

You can check the trigger by editing the "Run Trigger.cmd" and setting the days to 181 instead of 30, re-running normally (not admin) and rebooting. It will run the kmsnano program.

Don't forget to set the days back to 30 (or whatever is comfortable, but less than 179 for sure) and rerun the script normally (again, not as admin).

Office 2013 stuff still has issues atm. They are working out the kinks as best they can.

For those having problems with office 2013, try running the .net Repair tool from microsoft.

If that doesn't work, try extracting kmsnano.exe to a directory and run "kmseldi /nowin /no2010 /log" When it is up and running click the big "EL" button and it will try to activate office 2013.

If that doesn't work, nothing will work for you except online activation, and I'm not sure exactly how to do that. something like running ospp commands pointed at an online kms server.

Hi murphy
can u tell me waht is difference b/w KMSNano & Korean permanent activators, as kms activate for 180days while other one is really permanent?

Do NOT use  the Korean activator. It does not activate, it just performs sloppy surgery on your system files. First it mixes some messed up versions of system files, I honestly don't know exactly which files it replaces because I avoid it like the plague ever since I tried it once.

Then it hacks some dll files to DISPLAY false activation information on the activation page of pc info. If you type "slmgr /dlv" in your command prompt you will see that it is NOT activated. It won't behave like it is activated, because you cannot download any windows updates with the Korean activator.  If you even attempt to use it on a version of windows like this one that has all the updated kb files, it will blue screen of death you, and the only way you will be able to fix it is to boot from your dvd or usb and run the system restore from before you used it.

That FireIsHot guy who linked a 2meg activator isn't fooling anybody. If you fall for that after being warned, you deserve what follows.

I don't have to sell the usefulness of this kms offline activator, the other crap doesn't work.

I have no idea what the WT8 KMS 1.1 is, but it sounds like an online kms activator. That's great and all, but keys will get blocked the more you use them. That's why this offline activator is so desirable.

As far as ProWMC, they closed all the loopholes, there's no way to activate it without either purchasing it or restoring a previously activated tokens backup.
